content:
I am passionate about improving policymaking by harnessing the power of data science and artificial intelligence. As a data science manager at the Federal Reserve Board, I lead a team with a diverse project workload that includes research, policy, and operational data and software projects. My personal portfolio includes technology leadership, research efforts, technical expertise, and teaching experience. My research includes work on international trade, graph neural networks, natural language processing, and more. I am experienced with technologies such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hadoop, Spark, Impala, spaCy, NLTK, R, and Python.
The views in this website are solely the responsibility of the author and should not be interpreted as reflecting the views of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System or of any other person associated with the Federal Reserve System.
summary: I am passionate about improving policymaking by harnessing the power of data science and artificial intelligence. As a data science manager at the Federal Reserve Board, I lead a team with a diverse project workload that includes research, policy, and operational data and software projects. My personal portfolio includes technology leadership, research efforts, technical expertise, and teaching experience. My research includes work on international trade, graph neural networks, natural language processing, and more.
title: Anderson Monken

summary: Highlighting the methods needed to assure that ML and AI models are explainable, fair, and bias-free.
title: Assuring AI methods for economic policymaking

summary: Demonstrating relationship between textual analytics sentiment and output prices during global supply chain bottlenecks.
title: Effects of Supply Chain Bottlenecks on Prices using Textual Analysis

summary: Harnessing big data techniques to analyze bill of lading data for timely international trade indicators.
title: Bill of Lading Data in International Trade Research with an Application to the COVID-19 Pandemic

summary: AI methods to improve analysis of black swan events in international trade.
title: Public policymaking for international agricultural trade using association rules and ensemble machine learning

summary: Novel graph neural network method to model worldwide trade in the context of a network graph to predict trade unit value.
title: Graph Neural Networks for Modeling Causality in International Trade

summary: Ensemble machine learning and association rules mining to improve agricultural trade during outlier events.
title: Artificial Intelligence Methods for Evaluating Global Trade Flows

summary: Study of the trans-Golgi network proteins to better understand membrane trafficking.
title: Structure and evolution of ENTH and VHS/ENTH-like domains in tepsin

summary: Using cross-sectional regressions and panel regressions to study the effects of child health on the population of Krygyzstan during civil unrest in 2010-2012.
title: Security, Trust, and Child Health in Kyrgyzstan, 2010-2012.

summary: Using protein x-ray crystallography, the structure of VHS-like domain of Tepsin is determined.
title: Structure Determination of the VHS-Like Domain of Tepsin
